channel.title: Make chat text from regulat players gray, mods blue and owner red?
channel.description:
How would i go about making the chat text IN THE CHATBOX a different color depending on the player rights?
EX; The owner says "Welcome, everyone!" and the Mod says "Hey, Brennan:)" I wondered if it could look like this (owner is Brennan, mod is Joe) "Brennan: Welcome, everyone!" "Joe: Hey, Brennan:)"

item.title: Make chat text from regulat players gray, mods blue and owner red?
item.dc:creator: @PushedPrawn PushedPrawn
item.description:
@PushedPrawn wrote:

GrimReapersScythe:

Yes, I see that, but he double posted, because he wasn’t receiving answers in his other topic.

Actually, i posted in one section, someone told me it was client sided and i posted in this section then my other post had gotten moved to this one as well. I don’t know if that counts as double posting.

Read full topic

item.title: Make chat text from regulat players gray, mods blue and owner red?
item.dc:creator: @Tonic Tonic
item.description:
@Tonic wrote:

[quote=“PushedPrawn, post:1, topic:306376”]How would i go about making the chat text IN THE CHATBOX a different color depending on the player rights?

EX; The owner says “Welcome, everyone!” and the Mod says “Hey, Brennan:)” I wondered if it could look like this (owner is Brennan, mod is Joe)
“Brennan: Welcome, everyone!”
“Joe: Hey, Brennan:)”[/quote]

Search for this in Client.java

class30_sub2_sub1_sub4.method385(0, aStringArray944[k], i1, 822, 4);

You should see something like this.

if(l == 0) { if(i1 > 0 && i1 < 120) class30_sub2_sub1_sub4.method385(0, aStringArray944[k], i1, 822, 4); j++; }

Then replace this line —> class30_sub2_sub1_sub4.method385(0, aStringArray944[k], i1, 822, 4);

With this —> class30_sub2_sub1_sub4.method389(false, false, 4, 0, aStringArray944[k], i1);

Basically it lets you use colours in server-sided sendMessage("") text, such as sendMessage("@gre@This text is green").

Read full topic
